info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 6:29PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Pondera and north central Teton Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 628 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Choteau, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Conrad and Farmington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 335 and 344. Highway 89 between mile markers 48 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for north central Montana.
